reviews.review_msg: His lectures were boring and the tests were on very small concepts that he barely touched on. The TA made up for the lack of information that Paul provided. His lecture topics felt old and out of date, and he used incorrect terminology on more than one occasion.

Paul has been one of the best profs Ive had. Makes class concepts super clear and easy to understand. The TA was the worst Ive ever had in 4 years at SFU. Made tutorials pointless and graded super hard. When asked why you got a certain grade, he had no reason or explaination for how or why he graded how he did.
Pauls lectures are awesome and funny. The content is interesting, highly relevant and makes you think.
Paul is an amazing professor. He cares about his students and runs an interesting class. Very appreciated, great way to end my SFU career!
Need to show up to lecture to do well and need to participate in tutorial. He is a smoke show if you are into the British accents and soft hands. Loves the aliens.

Dr. K is knowledgeable in consumption studies. He makes difficult concepts easy to grasp by using modern relevant examples to highlight the theories. You won't do well if you miss his lectures-which you don't want to miss anyhow because they are highly entertaining. Go see him for more ideas when writing your paper-he can provide more angles.

Truly, Paul is brilliant. Inside and out.  He is very kind, approachable, caring and the most passionate soul I have ever met. He is an excellent lecturer and very fair. Great sense of humour! Very engaging!  He is incredibly interesting and inspiring. The dept is very lucky to have someone like him. Also, the dept is amazing too! You will love it!

Paul is a terrific professor but a very difficult marker. Like many of the posts already made, you will not do well if you skip lectures.  Because of his strong research background, many of the concepts he covers are quite obscure. As such, you will be unable to wiki/google the answers. I recommend attending his office hours.
Skip a class, u won't pass. Period. u must listen to his lecture in order to understand the slides. the themes can be really really abstract, so listen n take notes.
Social geography is one of those courses  either you get it or u don't, there is no in between. Wanna to pass? don't ever skip a lecture, listen and write. Nice prof.
Paul is a great teacher, and person. Really fair, and is always there for his students. He encourages questions in class. Make sure to give your self lots of time for the essay. Recommend the class!

I took both GEOG 325 and 420 with him and he shows interest in what he teaches. However, sometimes (especially in 420) I thought I was wasting my money taking his class since one lecture was on Sherlock Holmes and others weren't even practical. He is a tough marker on tests (wants a lot of detail) and on the essay.

Paul is my fav prof at SFU. Emphasizes that hes there to help you along with your paper or if you have any questions. No textbook but light readings from journals he uploads. Tutorial participation is essential. Midterm and final are fair. Class material is super interesting and you can tell that Paul is also passionate in what he teaches.

Paul is super friendly and interesting. GEOG 325 is not a very practical course, its kinda like cultural geography. Interesting, but very social sciencey. I worked for my A- but nothing too strenuous. Paul is very fair and going to see him in his office hours is actually fun...

Paul is one of the best profs I've had at SFU. Work hard, read the material (journals) and you will do well. Ask questions if you are unsure. He's not just welcoming to office hours, he encourages it. I will definitely be taking his upper level courses.
Great class and Prof. (easily one of the best @ SFU). Interesting but tough tutorial readings and marking. I think he said the class average was C+ / B- I worked REALLY hard to get a B.

GPA booster. There is no textbook and the only reading is a  journal article (usually around 10 pages) every week for tutorials. He even gives you a study guide for the midterm and final. Attend lecture every week and you'll ace the class with minimal effort.
He is a great teacher! He really tries to motivates the class. Good lecturer, his grading structure is a bit odd. If you get

Paul is a amazing at clearly conveying the material to his students; after every lecture I felt I had a very clear understanding of what he talked about.  He is also the most approachable professor (don't be afraid to go to his office hours).  Memorize the terms on his study guides and work hard on the paper and you'll get an A in this class.

Paul is the best prof I've ever had! I'm glad I took this course in my last semseter of undergrad. He explains materials really well, he cares about his students, he is always keen in helping his students, etc! I highly recommend this prof to all of you who are interested in taking geog courses.

Great prof! He really explains things well! Midterm & final were fair, but becareful, make sure your answers are really detailed or you'll get a lot of marks docked off! Paper is a bit difficult, very broad guidelines but just do your best. Very interesting class and yes, TA Kristin MIlehenney is really good! Funny guy and  you'll love his accent!

He's interested in his subject but tends to get a bit theoretical; learn the terms and years for different theories and the exams are a cinch. Bring in example for Vancouver, he likes them since he's new to this part of the world. Nice guy and pretty casual; if he finishes his lecture early he'll let everyone go. TA Kristin McIlhenney was AWESOME!

Wow he is passionate about Geog.  Everything he sees thru the eyes of geog.  Great lectures, follow the study guide for midterm and final and you are ensured an A.  Loved the class and the course and the material.  Will and do plan to take another course with him.
Man~~~ what a great prof.... the best in geog department, give out study guide for midterm and final... sure to get a good mark if you study all the terms in the study guide

Great class, best GEOG i've taken so far! Paul is very clear, organized and engaging in lecture. The midterm was very fair. The tutorials are very enjoyable with awesome discussions. The paper was difficult but you get to choose your topic and they are accessible for help. It is good to know there are classes like this where I actually learn & enjo

best geog course ive taken thus far, and one of the best prof's you could ask for.  VERY helpful, VERY approachable.  adds humor to his lectures, very clear, exams more than fair.   he really wants to get to know his students, and is definitely looking out for our well being.  I'll be searching for more classes w/him!

You can't help but love the English accent. He does a good job of explaining content fully, and using visuals to aid in discussion. At first the class can be a little philosophical but stay with it, he does a good job integrating information.
great prof! very clear about course content and expectations. his passion for geography makes lectures pertinent and interesting.
Great prof, very passionate about geography. Clear and interesting lectures. Highly recommended.
